article.headline: Mississippi State 78, Charlotte 69
article.story: STARKVILLE, Miss. (AP) -- Jamont Gordon scored 20 points Wednesday to lead Mississippi State to a 78-69 victory over Charlotte. Gordon was 6 of 10 from the field and the point guard also led the Bulldogs (3-2) in rebounds for the fourth time this season with 12. Mississippi State committed a season-low 11 turnovers, including just two in the second half, to stop a two-game losing streak. A pair of freshmen, Ben Hansbrough and Barry Stewart, added 15 and 13 points, and Charles Rhodes chipped in 11. The 49ers (2-3) led by six early and were tied late in the first half. But Hansbrough hit a running 3-pointer at the buzzer to give the Bulldogs a 29-26 halftime advantage. The Bulldogs grabbed a season-high 46 rebounds and earned 28 points in the paint. Leemire Goldwire led the 49ers with 23 points, hitting 7 of 8 free throws. De'Angelo Alexander added 14 points and Drayton chipped in 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
